physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Multiple minute discrete and confluent vesicles filled with either clear fluid or blood encompassing an area of approximately 16 x 16 cm across the posterior aspect of the right shoulder, extending from the medial right scapular border to the right posterior axillary fold.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At the 6-week follow-up, there was no improvement and the lesions had become more prominent. At the 1-month follow-up after sclerotherapy, complete resolution of previously treated lesions was observed. At the most recent follow-up, lymphangiomas could not be detected and the patient reported no increased sensitivity.
